Localized (just under breastbone or larger area of mid-chest; or entire upper chest).
Common combination of mid-chest, neck and jaw.
Mid-chest and inside arms. Left arm and shoulder more frequent than the right side.
Upper abdomen where most often mistaken for indigestion.
Larger area of chest, neck, jaw and inside arms.
Lower center of neck, to both sides of upper neck; and jaw from ear to ear.
Inside right arm from armpit to below elbow; inside arm to waist. Left side is more frequent.
At the back, between the shoulder blades.
